TopicTitle: Just what are Kerbals made of that they're so tough??

Articles.Content:
Rescue a Kerbal on Minmus.  I've got a leftover science craft in Minmus orbit, I refuel it and send it down and the comedy begins.

Unfortunately, she's on a steep slope.  My lander lands and begins sliding down the slope at about 1 m/s.  I switch to her and give chase.  I use her jetpack to get close and then try to run around in front of it (it's sliding down with the door in front) and then use the jetpack to jump up.  This doesn't work very well and my jetpack keeps shutting down even though I didn't actually get a grip on the rocket.  The physics model has a problem here and throws me aside multiple times, the last time throwing me through the rocket and bouncing off the ground just in front of a landing leg.  She's fine, the leg goes boom.

Reload, I decide to see what the lander will do.  As I write this it's skiing down the lowlands of Minmus.  I can see flat terrain ahead, it's going to have to stop sometime.  I'm 1.7km from touchdown.

Edit:  I came back to find it basically at rest more than 4km from the initial landing point.  I was skiing on lowlands, I'm stationary on slopes?!?!?!  (And it turns out I'm not stationary--I got the Kerbal, came back and it's sliding at a quarter of a m/s.)

Edited July 12, 2016 by Loren Pechtel
